categories.title: Recent Updates and Fixes in ElizaOS Plugins

content.text: Several updates and fixes have been made to ElizaOS plugins, including the removal of the incomplete DefiLlama plugin, improvements to the Rabbi Trader and Solana plugins, and resolving conflicts in the Near-Solana slippage environment variables.
A fix was implemented for the Starknet plugin, replacing the walletProvider with a portfolio provider to resolve broken references. This allows users to utilize the Starknet plugin without issues.

A fix was introduced to resolve plugin import issues in character files, ensuring that community-published plugins without default exports are properly handled. This update improves error handling and maintains backward compatibility.
The plugin-web-search README was moved to the correct directory to align with project standards.

New plugins were introduced, including the B2 Network plugin for BTC L2 interactions, the Akash Network plugin for autonomous cloud deployment, and the NillionDB plugin. Additionally, the Lens Network plugin was added to support Grass token transfers.
A fix was applied to resolve syntax issues in the Autonome plugin and update the lock file.
A new Solana web3.js V2 plugin was introduced, along with automated liquidity provisioning on Orca. This update ensures compatibility with the latest Solana SDK.
The plugin-web-search was updated to use google.serper.dev for improved search functionality.
A new StakeWise plugin was added to fetch vault data, including APY and TVL metrics, with validation for accuracy and usability.
The CKB Fiber plugin was introduced, enabling Eliza agents to interact with the Fiber Network for stablecoin payments using the Lightning Network.
A Quai Network plugin was added, allowing native QUAI token transfers, secure transaction signing, and network connection management.
The Code In Plugin was introduced, allowing users to store character JSON files on the blockchain permanently using the IQ6900 inscription standard.
A new plugin for generating dad jokes was added, serving as a simple example for developers to understand provider and evaluator concepts.
A discussion was started regarding long-term memory for personal assistants in the Telegram client, exploring ways to retain information beyond recent messages.

categories.title: Recent Updates and Fixes in ElizaOS

content.text: A fix was implemented to remove a conflict between Near and Solana configurations regarding the `SLIPPAGE` environment variable. The plugin documentation was updated accordingly.
A translation type issue was resolved to fix the development environment. The change was untested, and its impact on transcription is uncertain.
A typo was fixed in the Russian version of the README file to enhance documentation clarity.
The Allora section of `plugins.md` was updated to fix a comment-uncomment typo and add a link to more comprehensive documentation and examples.
Legacy environment variables (`XAI_MODEL`, `XAI_API_KEY`, and `IMAGE_GEN`) were removed as they were no longer in use. Documentation was updated accordingly.
An outdated website URL in `lore.md` was updated to ensure accuracy.
Technical documentation was optimized for LLMs and vectorization, improving JSDoc comments and adding support for object documentation.
The `RPC_URL` variable was replaced with `SOLANA_RPC_URL` and `NEAR_RPC_URL` to improve clarity and avoid conflicts.
Documentation was added to explain the Verifiable Inference functionality, an important feature for building autonomous agents.
The `clients.md` documentation was updated to correct the package name from `@eliza` to `@elizaos` for successful installation and imports.
Support for Twitter photo uploads was added.
Support for the Autonome platform was introduced.
A Brazilian Portuguese version of the README was added to the documentation to improve accessibility for Portuguese-speaking developers.

categories.title: AI and Crypto Developments: Asia Tour, Eliza Updates, and Verifiable AI

content.text: Shawn (@shawmakesmagic) has been traveling across Korea and Tokyo, meeting AI agent developers and enthusiasts. He has been spreading awareness through streams and interviews. Bounties are available for data wrangling notes from recent streams to enhance documentation.

Eliza, a key AI agent project, has seen several updates: it is now available in Roblox and Hyperfy, with the latter being open-sourced. A new UI is in development, and verifiable inference is being explored to ensure AI authenticity. Additionally, V2 of @vvaifudotfun has been released.

Discussions around AI and crypto continue, with @dankvr highlighting the unique nature of @daosdotfun, where DAOs like ai16z can act as memecoins while also holding and trading other tokens. The project has grown as people launched new initiatives.

The AI agent and infrastructure ecosystem is currently cooling down, making it a good time for re-evaluation. Builders are encouraged to delete outdated theses and develop new narratives, focusing on projects that prioritize development over price speculation.

Eliza has introduced a Text-to-Speech (TTS) feature supporting over 15 languages, including English, Korean, Japanese, Spanish, German, and Russian. This enhancement aims to improve AI interaction capabilities.
Mistral AI has been added as a new model provider for Eliza. The integration follows established SDK patterns, allowing for text and object generation with configurable model parameters.

A new Primus zkTLS plugin has been introduced to fully verify AI agent activities. This cryptographic protocol ensures transparency and trust by verifying LLM inference, actions, and external interactions in a privacy-preserving manner.

The cryptocurrency market has seen fluctuations in the prices of major assets. Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) experienced a decline from $95,062.89 to $92,397.02. Similarly, Wrapped Ethereum (WETH) dropped from $3,327.40 to $3,218.77. Solana (SOL) also saw a decrease, moving from $197.49 to $184.95. The ai16z token followed the trend, falling from $1.71 to $1.42.

categories.title: Database Adapter Fixes and Improvements in ElizaOS

content.text: A fix was implemented for the `pglite` database adapter, adding missing implementations for key functions such as `getKnowledge`, `searchKnowledge`, `createKnowledge`, `removeKnowledge`, and `clearKnowledge`. This resolves a previously incomplete feature in the database adapter.

A new conditional was added to the `initializeDatabase` function to simplify the use of Supabase as a database option. Users can now configure Supabase by adding `SUPABASE_URL` and `SUPABASE_ANON_KEY` to their `.env` file, eliminating the need for manual code modifications.

A minor bug fix was applied to `packages/adapter-postgres/schema.sql`, ensuring that the `isShared` column is properly quoted with double quotes. This resolves an issue where PostgreSQL failed to initialize due to a missing column reference.

A bug was reported where the `schema.sql` file was missing from the published `@elizaos/adapter-postgres` package, causing database initialization to fail. This issue needs to be addressed to ensure proper migrations.

Database query performance was optimized by moving sorting and slicing logic to the database layer. This change significantly improved memory-fetching speed, reducing query execution time from 40 seconds to 0.02 seconds in a dataset with 60,000 records.

Fixes were applied to the Supabase adapter to prevent errors when fetching missing rooms. The `getRoom()` function now uses `.maybeSingle()` instead of `.single()`, and database seed values were updated to include valid timestamps and required fields. Additionally, mixed-case column names are now properly quoted to prevent PostgreSQL from auto-lowering them.

categories.title: Chat Discussions and Technical Issue with Llama_Local Model

content.text: @NEETOCRACY @armyofindians lets chat, DMs open

A chat transcript primarily consisted of messages from a single user, 'Captain Hook,' with no meaningful technical discussions or problem-solving. Another user, 'yikesawjeez,' asked about adding a bot to their server but received no response.

A reported issue with the 'llama_local' model causing an infinite chat loop. The model works fine with OpenAI but encounters problems when running locally. Logs indicate various initialization steps, warnings about deprecated parameters, and missing CUDA support, which may contribute to performance issues. The character 'Local Eliza' is configured with specific settings, including a unique personality and roleplay elements.

categories.title: Recent Updates and Feature Requests in ElizaOS

content.text: A new configuration variable, TELEGRAM_API_ROOT, has been added to the .env file to specify the root URL of the Telegram API. This change is low-risk and does not affect existing functionality. Documentation updates are required, and testing involves verifying that the application correctly reads the new configuration variable.

A suggestion has been made to implement a general logging system for version 2.0, potentially using Pino. The proposal includes switching to JSON-based logging for better indexing and searching of log data.
The @elizaos/plugin-twitter package has not yet been published on npm, despite being mentioned in the README. A request has been made to publish it as soon as possible.

A new feature has been added to support Google Gemini in the image vision provider. The refactoring allows for easier extension, and the update is considered low-risk. The README.md in the plugin-node folder has been updated accordingly. Testing involved verifying the Twitter client with OpenAI and Gemini keys.

categories.title: Interoperability, Open Source AGI, and Decentralized Funding

content.text: Agents are emerging as a key interoperability layer between applications, enabling seamless integration and communication.
Excitement is building around decentralized funding initiatives, with support for projects like Gitcoin, Allo Capital, and Greenpill.
Open-source AGI is positioned to succeed regardless of the competitive landscape, reinforcing the importance of transparency and collaboration in AI development.

Significant progress is being made in automating functions across technical and organizational levels. Soon, daily digests, weekly newsletters, and automated tweet threads will be available to streamline updates and announcements. Testing is currently underway.
A roundup of recent updates and news from the past week is being compiled. Additional updates can be shared in the comments.

A long list of updates has been compiled from the past week. Work is nearing completion on a workflow to streamline daily and weekly digests, which will also be applied retroactively to past updates. There is also consideration for creating an Eliza plugin for this process.
